intro: Hieracium retzii, commonly known as the lesser spearthistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium retzii is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
